benchmark_details.name: CG-MER (Card Game-based Multimodal dataset for Emotion Recognition)
benchmark_details.overview: The CG-MER dataset is a comprehensive French multimodal dataset designed specifically for emotion recognition, encompassing three primary modalities: facial expressions, speech, and gestures. It was curated through engaging participants in card game sessions where they expressed a range of emotions while responding to diverse questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a valuable resource for emotion recognition research among French-speaking individuals.

data.source: Data was collected through 10 sessions involving card game interactions between 20 participants.
data.annotation: Data was annotated through self-annotations, partner annotations, and external observers' evaluations.

methodology.validation: Data collection followed a structured protocol involving participant consent and detailed annotation instructions.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Data includes 20 participants (9 female, 11 male) aged 20 to 43.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset adheres to ethical standards approved by GDPR, with participants providing written consent after reviewing detailed information about data collection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided written consent to use their data for research purposes.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The dataset complies with GDPR regulations.
